availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Billups (Athens, Clarke County, Georgia, planter and president of Georgia Senate )

body.p: Athens, Clarke County, Georgia, planter and president of Georgia Senate. Georgia native. Father of Anna Y. Billups, Thomas C. Billups, William Billups, John Billups, Henry C. Billups, and Sarah J. Billups. Married to Anna M. Billups c1850. Planter in Athens, Georgia in 1850. Farmer in Athens, Georgia in 1860. Elected president of the Georgia Senate on November 6, 1861. Captain of Athens, Georgia militia (C.S.A.) in spring 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Georgia, Clarke County, Athens, p. 40.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Georgia, Clarke County, Athens, p. 1053.Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Georgia, Clarke County, Athens, p. 439.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Georgia, Clarke County, Athens, p. 12.Find A Grave, "John Billups (June 11, 1802-February 13, 1872)," Memorial #44527912, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44527912 (accessed January 28, 2020). Lucian Lamar Knight, A Standard History of Georgia and Georgians (New York, NY: The Lewis Company Publishing, 1917), 764. John F. Stegman, These Men She Gave: Civil War Diary of Athens, Georgia (Athens, GA: University of Georgia Press, 2009), 108. KYR-0004-033-0037.
